page.title: 19Traction engine club
page.content:
The{North Staffordshire and Cheshire {Traction Engine club}is based at {Klondyke Mill}in Draycott in the Clay. The members own their own engines and maintain them on the club premises.
Every year the club organises a very successful{bonfire and fireworks display to celebrate Guy Fawkes night. The club also holds an "open day" twice a year, which is popular with the local dads as well as their children.
The site was formerly a brick works and later a plaster and cement mill. An embankment is all that remains of the track on which horses once pulled alabaster from the{Draycott mine}to be turned into plaster.
